016
017package squidpony.squidai.astar;
018
019import squidpony.squidmath.BinaryHeap;
020
021import java.util.Collections;
022import java.util.List;
023
024/**
025 * An indexed A* pathfinder that works with a Graph of nodes (generic type {@code N}). The path this returns is an
026 * ArrayList of {@link Connection} items, which can be entered in order to handle movement. You can also receive an
027 * ArrayList of nodes instead, which may make more sense if the Connections always have the same cost. The node type is
028 * often {@link squidpony.squidmath.Coord}, and the Graph is often a {@link DefaultGraph} in that case.
029 * <p>
030 * This implementation is a common variation of the A* algorithm that is faster than the general A*; it was originally
031 * from gdx-ai as IndexedAStarPathFinder.
032 * <p>
033 * In the general A* implementation, data are held for each node in the open or closed lists, and these data are held as a
034 * NodeRecord instance. Records are created when a node is first considered and then moved between the open and closed lists, as
035 * required. There is a key step in the algorithm where the lists are searched for a node record corresponding to a particular
036 * node. This operation is somewhat time-consuming.
037 * <p>
038 * The indexed A* algorithm improves execution speed by using an array of all the node records for every node in the graph. Nodes
039 * must be numbered using sequential integers (see {@link Graph#getIndex(Object)}), so we don't need to search for a node in the
040 * two lists at all. We can simply use the node index to look up its record in the array (creating it if it is missing). This
041 * means that the close list is no longer needed. To know whether a node is open or closed, we use the {@link NodeRecord#category
042 * category} of the node record. This makes the search step very fast indeed (in fact, there is no search, and we can go straight
043 * to the information we need). Unfortunately, we can't get rid of the open list because we still need to be able to retrieve the
044 * element with the lowest cost. However, we use a {@link BinaryHeap} for the open list in order to keep performance as high as
045 * possible.
046 * 
047 * @param <N> Type of node
048 * 
049 * @author davebaol
050 */
051public class Pathfinder<N> {
052        protected Graph<N> graph;
053        protected NodeRecord<N>[] nodeRecords;
054        protected BinaryHeap<NodeRecord<N>> openList;
055        protected NodeRecord<N> current;
056        public Metrics metrics;
057
058        /** The unique ID for each search run. Used to mark nodes. */
059        private int searchId;
060
061        public static final int UNVISITED = 0;
062        public static final int OPEN = 1;
063        public static final int CLOSED = 2;
064
065        public Pathfinder(Graph<N> graph) {
066                this(graph, false);
067        }
068
069        @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
070        public Pathfinder(Graph<N> graph, boolean calculateMetrics) {
071                this.graph = graph;
072                this.nodeRecords = (NodeRecord<N>[])new NodeRecord[graph.getNodeCount()];
073                this.openList = new BinaryHeap<>();
074                if (calculateMetrics) this.metrics = new Metrics();
075        }
076        /**
077         * Performs a non-interruptible search, trying to find a path made up of connections from the start node to the goal node
078         * attempting to honor costs provided by the graph.
079         *
080         * @param startNode the start node
081         * @param endNode the end node
082         * @param heuristic the heuristic function
083         * @param outPath the output path that will only be filled if a path is found, otherwise it won't get touched.
084         * @return {@code true} if a path was found; {@code false} otherwise.
085         */
086        public boolean searchConnectionPath (N startNode, N endNode, Heuristic<N> heuristic, List<Connection<N>> outPath) {
087
088                // Perform AStar
089                boolean found = search(startNode, endNode, heuristic);
090
091                if (found) {
092                        // Create a path made of connections
093                        generateConnectionPath(startNode, outPath);
094                }
095
096                return found;
097        }
098
099        /**
100         * Performs a non-interruptible search, trying to find a path made up of nodes from the start node to the goal node attempting
101         * to honor costs provided by the graph.
102         *
103         * @param startNode the start node
104         * @param endNode the end node
105         * @param heuristic the heuristic function
106         * @param outPath the output path that will only be filled if a path is found, otherwise it won't get touched.
107         * @return {@code true} if a path was found; {@code false} otherwise.
108         */
109        public boolean searchNodePath (N startNode, N endNode, Heuristic<N> heuristic, List<N> outPath) {
110
111                // Perform AStar
112                boolean found = search(startNode, endNode, heuristic);
113
114                if (found) {
115                        // Create a path made of nodes
116                        generateNodePath(startNode, outPath);
117                }
118
119                return found;
120        }
121
122        protected boolean search (N startNode, N endNode, Heuristic<N> heuristic) {
123
124                initSearch(startNode, endNode, heuristic);
125
126                // Iterate through processing each node
127                do {
128                        // Retrieve the node with smallest estimated total cost from the open list
129                        current = openList.pop();
130                        current.category = CLOSED;
131
132                        // Terminate if we reached the goal node
133                        if (current.node.equals(endNode)) return true;
134
135                        visitChildren(endNode, heuristic);
136
137                } while (openList.size > 0);
138
139                // We've run out of nodes without finding the goal, so there's no solution
140                return false;
141        }
142
143//      @Override
144//      public boolean search (PathFinderRequest<N> request, long timeToRun) {
145//
146//              long lastTime = TimeUtils.nanoTime();
147//
148//              // We have to initialize the search if the status has just changed
149//              if (request.statusChanged) {
150//                      initSearch(request.startNode, request.endNode, request.heuristic);
151//                      request.statusChanged = false;
152//              }
153//
154//              // Iterate through processing each node
155//              do {
156//
157//                      // Check the available time
158//                      long currentTime = TimeUtils.nanoTime();
159//                      timeToRun -= currentTime - lastTime;
160//                      if (timeToRun <= TheWay.TIME_TOLERANCE) return false;
161//
162//                      // Retrieve the node with smallest estimated total cost from the open list
163//                      current = openList.pop();
164//                      current.category = CLOSED;
165//
166//                      // Terminate if we reached the goal node; we've found a path.
167//                      if (current.node == request.endNode) {
168//                              request.pathFound = true;
169//
170//                              generateNodePath(request.startNode, request.resultPath);
171//
172//                              return true;
173//                      }
174//
175//                      // Visit current node's children
176//                      visitChildren(request.endNode, request.heuristic);
177//
178//                      // Store the current time
179//                      lastTime = currentTime;
180//
181//              } while (openList.size > 0);
182//
183//              // The open list is empty and we've not found a path.
184//              request.pathFound = false;
185//              return true;
186//      }
187
188        protected void initSearch (N startNode, N endNode, Heuristic<N> heuristic) {
189                if (metrics != null) metrics.reset();
190
191                // Increment the search id
192                if (++searchId < 0) searchId = 1;
193
194                // Initialize the open list
195                openList.clear();
196
197                // Initialize the record for the start node and add it to the open list
198                NodeRecord<N> startRecord = getNodeRecord(startNode);
199                startRecord.node = startNode;
200                startRecord.connection = null;
201                startRecord.costSoFar = 0;
202                addToOpenList(startRecord, heuristic.estimate(startNode, endNode));
203
204                current = null;
205        }
206
207        protected void visitChildren (N endNode, Heuristic<N> heuristic) {
208                // Get current node's outgoing connections
209                List<Connection<N>> connections = graph.getConnections(current.node);
210
211                // Loop through each connection in turn
212                for (int i = 0; i < connections.size(); i++) {
213                        if (metrics != null) metrics.visitedNodes++;
214
215                        Connection<N> connection = connections.get(i);
216
217                        // Get the cost estimate for the node
218                        N node = connection.getToNode();
219                        double nodeCost = current.costSoFar + connection.getCost();
220
221                        double nodeHeuristic;
222                        NodeRecord<N> nodeRecord = getNodeRecord(node);
223                        if (nodeRecord.category == CLOSED) { // The node is closed
224
225                                // If we didn't find a shorter route, skip
226                                if (nodeRecord.costSoFar <= nodeCost) continue;
227
228                                // We can use the node's old cost values to calculate its heuristic
229                                // without calling the possibly expensive heuristic function
230                                nodeHeuristic = nodeRecord.getEstimatedTotalCost() - nodeRecord.costSoFar;
231                        } else if (nodeRecord.category == OPEN) { // The node is open
232
233                                // If our route is no better, then skip
234                                if (nodeRecord.costSoFar <= nodeCost) continue;
235
236                                // Remove it from the open list (it will be re-added with the new cost)
237                                openList.remove(nodeRecord);
238
239                                // We can use the node's old cost values to calculate its heuristic
240                                // without calling the possibly expensive heuristic function
241                                nodeHeuristic = nodeRecord.getEstimatedTotalCost() - nodeRecord.costSoFar;
242                        } else { // the node is unvisited
243
244                                // We'll need to calculate the heuristic value using the function,
245                                // since we don't have a node record with a previously calculated value
246                                nodeHeuristic = heuristic.estimate(node, endNode);
247                        }
248
249                        // Update node record's cost and connection
250                        nodeRecord.costSoFar = nodeCost;
251                        if(metrics != null)
252                                metrics.maxCost = Math.max(metrics.maxCost, nodeCost);
253                        nodeRecord.connection = connection;
254
255                        // Add it to the open list with the estimated total cost
256                        addToOpenList(nodeRecord, nodeCost + nodeHeuristic);
257                }
258
259        }
260
261        protected void generateConnectionPath (N startNode, List<Connection<N>> outPath) {
262
263                // Work back along the path, accumulating connections
264                // outPath.clear();
265                while (current.node != startNode) {
266                        outPath.add(current.connection);
267                        current = nodeRecords[graph.getIndex(current.connection.getFromNode())];
268                }
269
270                // Reverse the path
271                Collections.reverse(outPath);
272        }
273
274        protected void generateNodePath (N startNode, List<N> outPath) {
275
276                // Work back along the path, accumulating nodes
277                // outPath.clear();
278                while (current.connection != null) {
279                        outPath.add(current.node);
280                        current = nodeRecords[graph.getIndex(current.connection.getFromNode())];
281                }
282                outPath.add(startNode);
283
284                // Reverse the path
285                Collections.reverse(outPath);
286        }
287
288        protected void addToOpenList (NodeRecord<N> nodeRecord, double estimatedTotalCost) {
289                openList.add(nodeRecord, estimatedTotalCost);
290                nodeRecord.category = OPEN;
291                if (metrics != null) {
292                        metrics.openListAdditions++;
293                        metrics.openListPeak = Math.max(metrics.openListPeak, openList.size);
294                }
295        }
296
297        protected NodeRecord<N> getNodeRecord (N node) {
298                int index = graph.getIndex(node);
299                NodeRecord<N> nr = nodeRecords[index];
300                if (nr != null) {
301                        if (nr.searchId != searchId) {
302                                nr.category = UNVISITED;
303                                nr.searchId = searchId;
304                        }
305                        return nr;
306                }
307                nr = nodeRecords[index] = new NodeRecord<>();
308                nr.node = node;
309                nr.searchId = searchId;
310                return nr;
311        }
312
313        /** This nested class is used to keep track of the information we need for each node during the search.
314         * 
315         * @param <N> Type of node
316         * 
317         * @author davebaol */
318        static class NodeRecord<N> extends BinaryHeap.Node {
319                /** The reference to the node. */
320                N node;
321
322                /** The incoming connection to the node */
323                Connection<N> connection;
324
325                /** The actual cost from the start node. */
326                double costSoFar;
327
328                /** The node category: {@link #UNVISITED}, {@link #OPEN} or {@link #CLOSED}. */
329                int category;
330
331                /** ID of the current search. */
332                int searchId;
333
334                /** Creates a {@code NodeRecord}. */
335                public NodeRecord () {
336                        super(0);
337                }
338
339                /** Returns the estimated total cost. */
340                public double getEstimatedTotalCost () {
341                        return getValue();
342                }
343        }
344
345        /** A class used by {@link Pathfinder} to collect search metrics.
346         * 
347         * @author davebaol */
348        public static class Metrics {
349                public int visitedNodes;
350                public int openListAdditions;
351                public int openListPeak;
352                public double maxCost;
353
354                public Metrics () {
355                }
356
357                public void reset () {
358                        visitedNodes = 0;
359                        openListAdditions = 0;
360                        openListPeak = 0;
361                        maxCost = 0.0;
362                }
363        }
364}
